title: Rollins School of Public Health
author: Wu Z; Berokwitz S; Heagerty P; Benkeser D
cleaned_text: Faculty, Biostatistics and Bioinformatics My methodological research focuses on the theory and applications of machine learning in causal inference. Specific areas of interest include vaccine statistics, competing risks, complex longitudinal data, and theory of robust nonparametric statistical inference. My collaborative research includes work on preventive vaccines, tuberculosis, and HIV prevention. [View Resume](https://apps.sph.emory.edu/RSPHPeople/files/resumes/cv_full1686235825146.pdf) Contact Information 1518 Causal Inference - HIV/AIDS Prevention - Infectious Disease - Machine Learning - Survival Analysis -
